column4: i'm trying to setup ssl on apache. i keep getting this error "[warn] RSA server certificate CommonName (CN) `www.blahblah.com'  does NOT match server name!?"  is this specific to the apache config or is it an issue with a cert?
that's because your server name doesn't match, it's in the apache config
make it match the cert on the server side
oh. ok. i added ServerName www.blah.com and it got rid of the error.  now it appears to just be hanging on connecting to www.blah.com
Excellent, now you can start watching "tail -f /var/log/apache2/error.log" and access.log on the server.
yeah check that dns is resolving at all
dns is definitely resolving. it's working on port 80
to the error logs then
just to make sure you can also ping your.site.com to make sure it's resolving. maybe restart browser. you know. :P
error.log and access.log is giving me nothing.  oh boy
sudo apachectl configtest?
that returns Syntax OK
are any other certs working on the server or is this your prototype ssl setup

reason i ask is the next step i'd take is comparing it to a working config side by side. there can be a lot of idiosyncracies with different people's apache configs. So if you have another on that server, it could be instructive to compare them...
this is my first ssl on this server.  i found that my firewall wasnt open to 443. now it is and it's hitting the site. of course im getting another error.
good, that one should be in error.log :)
yup! woohoo. error log got it.   Invalid method in request \x16\x03\x01
this point is where it's nice to have a "screen" session or at least a couple of terminal windows, with tail -f running on those logs
sounds like fun.
yeah, thanks for that tail -f tip. i've got them all open in terminal.  muuuch faster
you can get the same behavior with "less", hit shift+F with less opoen
